stimulusHtml: Although many theories exist to explain the overlapping forms of the animals in the Great Hall of the Bulls at Lascaux, some scholars have interpreted the repeated images as evidence of
choicesHtml: continuous narration, with the forms being repeated to show an ongoing sequence of events
physical challenges, because the artists were painting in total darkness before the invention of oil lamps
ritual activity, perhaps to ensure successful hunting of the animals depicted on the cave walls
funerary practices, since each animal appears to mark the grave of a different individual
